title: Cross-Framework Control Mapping
description: Maps common security control objectives across all 10 compliance frameworks, enabling organizations to see how a single implementation can satisfy requirements across multiple standards simultaneously.

mappings.description: Implementation of multi-factor authentication to verify user identity using two or more independent authentication factors.

soc2.notes: Trust Services Criteria requires logical access controls

hipaa.notes: Person or entity authentication for ePHI access

gdpr.notes: Technical measure for confidentiality under Article 32

cmmc.notes: MFA for privileged and network access

nist-ai-rmf.notes: Not directly addressed-defers to security frameworks

iso42001.notes: Defers to ISO 27001 for security controls

mappings.implementationNotes: Deploy MFA for all accounts accessing sensitive data. Prefer phishing-resistant methods (FIDO2/WebAuthn). Minimum: TOTP. Cover both privileged and standard accounts.

mappings.description: Encrypt sensitive data stored in databases, file systems, and storage services using strong cryptographic algorithms.

hipaa.notes: Encryption of ePHI at rest (addressable = implement or document why not)

gdpr.notes: Pseudonymization and encryption TOM under Article 32

pci-dss.notes: PAN must be rendered unreadable anywhere stored (Req 3)

nis2.notes: Cryptography and encryption policies per Article 21(2)(h)

mappings.implementationNotes: Use AES-256 for all sensitive data at rest. Implement KMS for key management. CMMC requires FIPS 140-2 validated modules. Rotate keys annually.

mappings.description: Implement comprehensive logging of security events, access to sensitive data, and administrative actions. Centralize and monitor logs.

pci-dss.notes: Log and monitor all access to CHD (Req 10). 12 month retention.

nis2.notes: Effectiveness assessment of risk management measures

mappings.implementationNotes: Log: auth events, data access, admin actions, system changes. Include timestamp, user ID, event type, outcome, source IP. Centralize in SIEM. Retention: 12 months (PCI DSS) to 6 years (HIPAA).

mappings.description: Implement role-based access control with least privilege to restrict system and data access to authorized personnel only.

iso27001.notes: Access control policy and privilege management

mappings.implementationNotes: Define roles based on job functions. Implement least privilege. Review access quarterly (PCI DSS requires quarterly review). Automate onboarding/offboarding.

mappings.description: Establish incident response plan, breach notification procedures, and post-incident review processes.

gdpr.notes: 72-hour DPA notification. Data subject notification for high-risk breaches.

dora.notes: 4-hour initial notification for major ICT incidents

nis2.notes: 24h early warning, 72h notification, 1 month final report

cmmc.notes: 72-hour notification to DoD via DIBNet portal

mappings.implementationNotes: Design for the shortest notification window (DORA: 4h). Key timelines: DORA 4h → NIS2 24h → GDPR 72h → HIPAA 60d. Implement tiered notification workflow. Conduct tabletop exercises quarterly.

mappings.description: Implement data masking, tokenization, and pseudonymization to minimize the exposure of sensitive data.

hipaa.notes: PHI de-identification using Safe Harbor or Expert Determination

gdpr.notes: Pseudonymization as a specific TOM in Article 32

pci-dss.notes: PAN truncation, tokenization, or rendering unreadable (Req 3)

dora.notes: Not explicitly required but supports ICT protection

nis2.notes: Part of cryptography and encryption policies

mappings.implementationNotes: Apply format-preserving encryption (FPE) for structured data. Use tokenization for cardholder data. Pseudonymize personal data for analytics. Implement PHI Safe Harbor method for HIPAA.

mappings.description: Implement session timeout controls to automatically terminate inactive sessions and require re-authentication.

pci-dss.notes: Session timeout for CDE access (15 minutes)

mappings.implementationNotes: Set idle timeout to 15 minutes (PCI DSS standard). Implement sliding window sessions. Force re-authentication for sensitive operations. Clear session on browser close.

mappings.description: Implement business continuity and disaster recovery plans with defined RTO/RPO, backup procedures, and regular testing.

hipaa.notes: Contingency plan including backup and DR

pci-dss.notes: Not explicitly mandated but implied in Req 12

dora.notes: Core DORA requirement: response, recovery, and backup

mappings.implementationNotes: Define RTO/RPO for all critical systems. Implement automated backups with offsite/multi-region storage. Test DR procedures at least annually. DORA mandates the most rigorous testing.

mappings.controlObjective: Consent Management and Data Subject Rights
mappings.description: Implement mechanisms for obtaining, tracking, and managing user consent and fulfilling data subject rights requests.

hipaa.notes: Addressed through NPP and patient rights

gdpr.notes: Core GDPR requirements: lawful basis, access, rectification, erasure, portability

mappings.implementationNotes: Build granular consent management. Implement DSAR workflow with 30-day response SLA (GDPR). Provide data export (JSON/CSV) for portability. Implement cascading deletes for erasure.

mappings.description: Implement vulnerability scanning, patch management, and penetration testing programs.

pci-dss.notes: Quarterly ASV scans, annual pen test (Req 11)

dora.notes: Most extensive: annual testing + TLPT every 3 years

nis2.notes: Security in acquisition and effectiveness assessment

iso42001.notes: Internal audit of AI management system

mappings.implementationNotes: Frequency: quarterly vulnerability scans (PCI DSS), annual penetration tests, TLPT every 3 years (DORA). Remediate critical findings within 30 days. Track via risk register.

mappings.description: Implement security awareness training programs for all employees, with specialized training for technical roles and management.

dora.notes: Implied as part of ICT risk management framework

nis2.notes: Basic cyber hygiene and training explicitly in Article 21(2)(g)

cmmc.notes: Security awareness training via NIST 800-171 AT controls

nist-ai-rmf.notes: Critical thinking mindset for AI workers

mappings.implementationNotes: Annual training for all staff. Phishing simulations monthly/quarterly. Role-specific training for developers, admins, and management. NIS 2 adds mandatory management body training.

mappings.description: Assess, manage, and monitor risks from third-party vendors, service providers, and supply chain partners.

soc2.notes: Risk assessment of vendors and partners

dora.notes: Most extensive: provider register, contractual provisions, concentration risk

cmmc.notes: Flow-down of CMMC requirements to subcontractors

iso42001.notes: Third-party AI component assessment and agreements

mappings.implementationNotes: Maintain vendor inventory with risk ratings. Execute framework-appropriate agreements (BAAs for HIPAA, DPAs for GDPR, DORA contractual provisions). Annual reassessment. Monitor concentration risk.
